resources.string: During this adventure you will be able to experience three more procedures. Attach, Handover and Carrier Aggregation.

Good job with unlocking needed cells! Now you can connect to one of them. To do that you need to choose suitable cell and attach. Which one is suitable? That one you will be CAPABLE to handle as a UE.
You will be communicating with network by scanning NFC tags in different places. To start scanning press "Start scanning". Scanning will stop automatically after tag will be scanned.
First step you need to know what is your capabilities. To know that scan first tag on YOUR desktop. Good luck with further adventures and procedures!

Frequencies:
 Technology:GSM / HSPA / LTE / 5G
 
 2G Bands:
 GSM - 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 - SIM 1 and SIM 2
 
 3G Bands:
 HSDPA - 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100
 
 4G Bands:
 LTE Band - 1(2100), 3(1800), 5(850), 7(2600), 8(900),34(2000), 38(2600), 39(1900), 40(2300), 41(2500)
 
 5G Bands:
 5G Band - 41(2500MHz, arfcn 499200-537996), 78(3500MHz, arfcn 620000-653332)
 
 Network Speed
 HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE-A, 5G (2+ Gbps DL)

NRCellDU=DRVI52C
Unfortunately attach not started.
UE is not cabable of Arfcn = 403500

PRACH: MSG1 
 ---------------------------------------->
 Successfully sent
 
 PDSCH: MSG2
 <----------------------------------------
 Received from GNB
 
 BB part of GNB is waiting for the next message
 ????-------------------------------------->
 
 Info: 
 MSG1 is the preamble sent by the UE on PRACH to request uplink sync and start the RA procedure.
 
 MSG2 is the Random Access Response sent by the gNB, providing timing advance, uplink grant, and temporary ID to the UE.

PUSCH:MSG 3 (RRCSetupRequest) 
 ---------------------------------------->
 Successfully sent
 
 PUSCH: RRCSetup
 <----------------------------------------
 Received from GNB
 
 Respond to the GNB using PUSCH
 ????-------------------------------------->
 
 Info: 
 MSG3 is the message sent after the Random Access Response, carrying UE identity or scheduling info.
 
 PUSCH: RRCSetup is the message sent by the gNB on PUSCH, delivering RRC parameters to establish the UE connection.

PUSCH:RRCSetupComplete 
 ---------------------------------------->
 Successfully sent
 
 NR RRC: SecurityModeCommand
 <----------------------------------------
 Received from GNB
 
 Respond to the GNB using NR RRC 
 ????-------------------------------------->
 
 Info: 
 RRCSetupComplete is the message sent by the UE to confirm RRC setup and provide initial NAS information.
 
 SecurityModeCommand is the message from the gNB to initiate ciphering and integrity protection setup for the UE.

NR RRC:SecurityModeComplete
 ---------------------------------------->
 successfully sent
 
 Attach procedure complete. Congratulations!
 Next letter is "C"
 But it is not an end of your travel.
 Your user has just started moving through the world
 To keep connection with the network you need to do a handover!
 To connect to another cell you need to scan neighbor cell nTAG. To find next cell nTAG you need to access cellMap
 You can access cellMap from "CableSocketInTheMiddleOfTheTable.db" on gNB.
Well done you have connected again.\n Go forward and try to find next cell. But next time check signal quality carefully.
RSRP = -67 dBm RSRQ = -8 dB Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?

But something is happening! It looks like your user has moved to the comfortable place and started watching YouTube with 2160p-4k quality – high data demand detected!\n \n Quickly find the locker number XX, open it and perform the Carrier Aggregation procedure to boost capacity and ensure smooth streaming.
RSRP = -67 dBm RSRQ = -8 dB Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?

\n Info: \n A PCI conflict in 5G NR happens when nearby cells share the same ID, causing interference during cell detection and handover. Connection was lost. Please re-attach to the network and try again. To do this scan re-attach tag in starting room.
RSRP = -80 dBm RSRQ = -9 dB Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?
Target cell rejected due to insufficient signal quality. Look for another cell with better signal.
RSRP = -85 dBm RSRQ = -6 dB Do you want to perform a Handover to this cell?
Target cell rejected due to insufficient signal quality. Look for another cell with better signal.
You have completed all necessary procedures. Throughput is on maximum level. User is watching video with maximum quality and stable connection. Last letter is "E"
